title.a: Update Traffic Collision with Entrapment 01/07/2022 INC#1782

item.description: Update Traffic Collision with Entrapment; INC#1782; 10:00PM; 612 W 26th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3q27jKN; #SanPedro; Sedan collided with an occupied residence, trapping *one* person (unknown age / gender) in the vehicle only, who has been determined dead at the scene. Though the vehicle and one involved unit in a row of bungalow-style homes were significantly damaged, there are no other injuries. Department of Building and Safety en route (ETA 11:00 PM) to determine if structure can be reoccupied. Media Inquiries: LAPD South Traffic Division (Incident #3522); FS 48; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC4 BC6 E101 E248 E285 E36 E85 EM13 HR3 RA112 RA79 RA848 RA85 T48 T85 UR85 UR88; CH7; 12 13; Brian Humphrey

Traffic Collision with Entrapment; INC#1782; 09:35PM; 612 W 26th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3q27jKN; #SanPedro; PRELIM: Solo vehicle into house with two persons trapped in vehicle. ; FS 48; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; E101 E248 EM13 RA112 RA848 T48; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0944; 01:18PM; 440 S Bonnie Brae St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3q3Gvd6; #Westlake; Thanks to the presence of functional fire sprinklers, the first arriving 20 LAFD Firefighters took just 11 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish flames in one 2nd (top) floor unit, of a 29-unit 19,346 square-foot two-story H-shaped center hallway apartment building (built 1923). No injury. Fire cause under investigation; FS 11; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC11 E11 E211 E220 RA13 RA811 SQ21 T11 T20; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0944; 01:07PM; 440 S Bonnie Brae St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3q3Gvd6; #Westlake; PRELIM: 2 story H-shaped center hallway apartment building with fire in one 2nd (top) floor unit, with fire sprinkler activation.; FS 11; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC11 E11 E211 E220 RA13 RA811 SQ21 T11 T20; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1240; 04:25PM; 1211 W Sunset Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3eV5Qjc; #EchoPark; The first arriving 30 Firefighters took just 11 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish flames in an offensive firefight within a vacant one story commercial building, where a rubbish fire had extended within the structure. No injury. Fire cause under investigation; FS 3; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC11 CM22 E11 E203 E211 E220 E9 EM1 RA20 T11 T20 T29 T3 T9; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#1240; 04:14PM; 1211 W Sunset Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Gfv47G; #EchoPark; PRELIM: Offensive firefight at vacant one story commercial building where inside rubbish fire is extending within the structure.; FS 3; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 E203 E211 E220 T11 T20 T3; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0932; 01:52PM; 233 W 98th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3f4CKh7; #BroadwayManchester; 33 firefighters took just 31 minutes to forcibly enter, overcome physical obstacles within, thoroughly search, confine and fully extinguish flames in an 874 square-foot one-story home (built 1913) that contained excessive personal storage. During initial fire attack, LAFD Firefighters discovered and rescued one elder adult male resident from the smoke charged structure. He has been taken to an area hospital by LAFD Paramedics in critical condition. No other injury reported. Fire cause under active investigation.; FS 64; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 CM32 E14 E15 E264 E33 EM13 RA14 RA264 RA4 RA846 RA864 T64; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0932; 01:21PM; 233 W 98th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3f4CKh7; #BroadwayManchester; PRELIM: One civilian rescued from within a smoke charged 1 story home containing excessive interior storage.; FS 64; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E14 E15 E264 E33 RA14 RA264 RA846 RA864 T64; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Update Natural Gas Leak; INC#0434; 09:28AM; 1922 N Hillhurst Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3pZ5Ftz; #LosFeliz; So Cal Gas utility workers have secured the 1" (one inch) diameter subterranean line and stopped the flow of natural gas leaking from beneath a sidewalk at or near a construction site. No fire. No injury. The small scale evacuation (unknown number of persons) and street closure in the immediate area have been discontinued. Media Inquiries: On-Site Construction Personnel and So Cal Gas; FS 35; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; BC5 E235 E35 T35; CH7; 13; Brian Humphrey

Natural Gas Leak; INC#0434; 08:17AM; 1922 N Hillhurst Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3pZ5Ftz; Los Feliz; PRELIM: Leak of natural gas from 1" (one inch) diameter line beneath a sidewalk at or near a construction site. No fire. No injury. LAFD crews have cordoned off the immediate area, and out of an abundance of caution, may briefly isolate or evacuate a handful of residential properties and businesses, and close lanes of traffic, in the immediate area only. So Cal Gas has been notified. No ETA. The specific cause of the leak has yet to be determined.; FS 35; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; E235 T35; CH7; Brian Humphrey
